- Harass him before level 2; his all-in threat increases significantly after unlocking W and Q.
- Use crowd control or displacement abilities to interrupt his Headbutt (W) dash.
- Punish him when his abilities are on cooldown; his engage tools have relatively long cooldowns.

- Coordinate with your ADC to bait out his engage, then counter-attack when his abilities are down.
- Be aware of his synergy with certain ADCs; champions like Draven or Tristana can capitalize on his engages effectively.
- When playing enchanter supports, keep protective abilities ready to counter his all-ins.
- Practice spacing and positioning to minimize his impact during laning phase.

- Coordinate with your team to collapse on him when he overextends or mispositions.
- Leverage champions with mobility and disengage tools to counter his engage attempts.

name: Aphelios
genericTips:
- Learn his weapon cycle: Aphelios has five weapons, each with unique abilities. Knowing which weapon he currently wields can help you predict his actions.
- Exploit his lack of mobility: Aphelios has no dash or escape ability. Engage him when his support is absent or when he's overextended.
- Punish during weak weapon combinations: Aphelios is less threatening when he has certain weapon combos. For instance, when he lacks Calibrum (green) or Gravitum (purple), he's more vulnerable.
- Avoid clumping in teamfights: His ultimate, Moonlight Vigil, can deal massive AoE damage, especially when combined with Infernum (red). Spread out to minimize its impact.
- Deny him farm early: Aphelios scales well into the late game. Applying early pressure can delay his power spikes.

name: Ashe

- Respect her early poke: Ashe's Volley (W) can harass effectively in lane. Position behind minions to reduce its impact.
- Avoid predictable movement: Her ultimate, Enchanted Crystal Arrow, is a global stun. Vary your movement patterns to make it harder for her to land.

- Build items that mitigate slows: Items like Mercury's Treads or Quicksilver Sash can help reduce the effectiveness of her crowd control.
- Engage after she uses Volley: Her W has a cooldown. After she uses it, there's a window to trade without immediate retaliation.
- Be aware of her Hawkshot (E): It provides vision. Avoid setting up ambushes in areas she can easily scout.
- In teamfights, prioritize flanking or engaging from angles where her ultimate is less likely to hit multiple targets.

name: Blitzcrank

- In teamfights, spread out to minimize the impact of his AoE silence from R (Static Field).

name: Elise

name: Evelynn

- **Early Game Pressure**: Evelynn is weak before level 6. Invade her jungle early to disrupt her farming and delay her level 6 power spike.

name: Ezreal
